FacilityName: Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative  --  Pierce, NE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Suggestions only.

1.  Facility Ploicy:  The owners, management and employees of Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the faciloity is prepared to work with the local fire department and law enforcement personnel to mitigate any releases to the population and the environment of our community.

2.  Facility Information:  This Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative facility has___7_____ full time employees.  The primary activity at this location is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received and stored while awaiting delivery to the farmers.  Nurse tanks are the only vessels used for the storage of anhydrous ammonia at this location.  During periods of non operation, of this facility, local law enforcement conducts inspections at various times of the day and nights.  Anything out of the ordinary is reported to our 24 hour number and appropriate action is taken.

3.   Worst-Case Release Scenario:  The worst-case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of one of storage tanks.  Details on our worst-case release scenario may be found in Section 2 of this Risk Mangement Plan.

4.  Alternative-Case Release Scenario:  The alternative-case release scenario is a release from a transfer hose failure.  Details on our alternative-case release scenario may be found in Section 3 of this Risk Management Plan.

5.  Accidental Release Prevention Program:  This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, published by the American National Standards Institure, Inc., and the Standard of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR Part 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia."

6.  Five Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any dea

ths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacutions, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

7.  Emergency Response Program.  Our facility has coordinated with the local responders and we do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.

8.  Planned Chages To Improve Safety:  Safety improvements are an on-going process at our facility.  Periodic evaulations are performed to assess our prevention and safety programs.  No changes are planned at this time.

9.  For additional information contact: Dawn Pochop, Safety & Regulatory, Battle Creek Farmers Cooperative, Battle Creek NE 68715  (402) 675-2375
